ALAN SHEARER ON THE FA CUP FINAL
Saturday sees the FA Cup final return to Wembley after a seven-year absence for what will be a very special day.


I had the honour of a sneak preview of the stadium about a month ago and if I had to sum up it up in one word I'd simply say, fantastic.


It really is very impressive. The spirit of the old Wembley remains, but the FA have delivered a brand new sparkling stadium of which we can all be proud.


Was it worth the wait? Well I think we would all have liked to have seen it delivered sooner, but I've no doubt everyone will be mightily impressed with it.


And what better way to celebrate than with the best two teams in the country slugging it out?


All week I've been asked to predict the outcome of the final, but this is a game that's just too close to call - you might as well flip a coin.


Manchester United had the upper hand in the Premiership and will probably go into the match in better mental shape than Chelsea, but whether that will be enough to win the Cup I don't know.


Chelsea will feel they have a point to prove, and are a very talented and resilient side.


The FA Cup is the only domestic trophy Jose Mourinho hasn't won at Chelsea, and he's not a man who accepts failure.


Big games bring out the best in big players, and there will be plenty of those on show on Saturday - Drogba, Rooney, Terry, Ferdinand, Scholes, Lampard.


But I have to reserve special praise for Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo.


There's no doubt this has been the Portuguese winger's season. He's been brilliant.


To perform the way he has in the face of so much criticism after the World Cup is very impressive and he thoroughly deserves his player of the year awards.


Enjoy the Cup final,


Alan


Alan Shearer was an FA Cup finalist with Newcastle in 1998 and 1999. He will be a guest in the Match of the Day studio at Wembley on Saturday.

FA CUP FINAL ON THE BBC

Saturday
Full coverage all day on bbc.co.uk/football; Match of the Day Live: FA Cup final - Chelsea v Man Utd (1240 BST, BBC ONE; kick off 1500 Radio Five Live/online). FA Cup highlights (2250, BBC ONE).
Sunday
FA Cup highlights loop (until midnight) on the red button (BBCi).
					
					
						Match of the Day's Cup final coverage includes features on Cristiano Ronaldo and Didier Drogba and a tour of the new Wembley with architect Lord Foster. Guests include Alan Hansen, Alan Shearer, Mark Hughes, Marcel Desailly and Peter Schmeichel. Plus a whole lot more.
